text:
Randy and Jenny Boyd are providing a $5.8 million gift to establish the Randy Boyd School of Hospitality and Tourism Management within the Haslam College of Business at the University of Tennessee, the university announced Monday.
The new school will be one of the first in the country to offer a comprehensive hospitality and tourism management program that combines business acumen with industry expertise. The gift from the Boyds is the largest donation ever made to the Haslam College of Business.
"This gift from Randy and Jenny Boyd is truly transformative for our college and for the state of Tennessee," said Steve Mangum, dean of the Haslam College of Business. "It allows us to create a premier institution for hospitality and tourism education, which will have a direct impact on the state's economy."
Randy Boyd, founder and chairman of Radio Systems Corporation, is a successful entrepreneur and philanthropist who has a deep appreciation for the importance of the hospitality and tourism industries in Tennessee.
"Jenny and I are thrilled to support this exciting initiative," Boyd said. "Hospitality and tourism are critical components of our state's economy, and we believe that by investing in education and training, we can help drive growth and innovation in these areas. We're proud to partner with the University of Tennessee to make this vision a reality."

The Randy Boyd School of Hospitality and Tourism Management will offer undergraduate and graduate degrees, as well as certification programs, to prepare students for careers in hospitality, tourism, and related fields.
